results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: David spends a happy day at the zoo looking at and feeding all the animals. When he returns home, he makes a zoo of his own. The animals come to life and the monkeys imprison the keeper and begin to release the other animals. Disaster threatens but Elsie the elephant comes to the rescue. Cast: Aaron Judah. Narration: Aaron Judah. Music: Alan Lane.

results.title: Donald Brittain: filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Donald Brittain was one of the most respected documentary filmmakers of his time and his work with the National Film Board of Canada earned him accolades from his peers and cemented his place in cinema history. This documentary examines the man behind the work and the work itself. He created films about heroes, “exposed villians” and offered filmgoers a “warts and all” expose of his subject and themes. This excellent documentary presents a frank and honest account of Brittain whose gift is described as being able to make the great man common and the common man great.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kent Martin, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: My father, my master = Padre, padrone.
results.creator_credit: Paolo Taviani, Vittorio Taviani, Guiliani de Negri and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This brutal film is based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Gavino Ledda which describes his youth and early adulthood as a shepard in the barren hill region of Sardinia. As a five year old Gavino was forcibly removed from school by his harsh peasant father who treated his eldest son as violently as he had been treated by his father before him. The illiterate Gavino eventually joined the army and educated himself to a point where he could stand up to his father and reject ancestral tradition and expectation. Though influenced greatly by Italian neo-realism, “Padre Padrone” also incorporates elements of fantasy and magical realism to convey the epic sweep of Gavino’s story. The author appears as himself in the prologue and epilogue. Both harrowing and deeply humanist, “Padre Padrone” richly deserved the Palme D’Or it won at Cannes in 1977.

results.title: Malice
results.creator_credit: Harold Becker, Charles Mulvehill, Rachel Pfeffer, Castle Rock and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dr. Jed Hill (Alec Baldwin) is an eminent doctor and the new head surgeon at Westerly Hospital. The newlywed Tracy Safian (Nicole Kidman) is admitted to hospital requiring emergency surgery. Dr. Hill defiantly performs an unnecessary operation which leaves her unable to have children. Hit with a $20 million dollar law suit, the truth begins to unravel - this is not the first time the medical whiz with miracle hands has played God, but will it be the last?

results.title: River of no return
results.creator_credit: Otto Preminger, Stanley Rubin and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Matt Calder (Robert Mitchum), is a widower with a dubious past, attempting to restart his life with his young son Mark. Harry Weston (Rory Calhoun) is a lawless gambler with his fiancee Kay (Marilyn Monroe). Calder rescues Weston and Kay from the river only to have Weston rob him and abandon them to the mercy of warring Indians. Calder takes Kay and Mark on a dangerous journey of revenge down the raging river. The chemistry between Mitchum and Monroe and the awe-inspiring backdrop of Canada’s breathtaking secenery are the highlights of this tense western thriller.

results.title: Boffins. - Volume 3.
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Ever wondered why the moon stays up, or why sounds travel through the air? Boffins do. The third volume in this delightful series will entertain children from 4-7 while helping to explain the “Laws of nature.” The episodes are: “Let there be light” (reflecting light), “Feeling blue” (prisms), “Moving matters” (friction), “Miracle of life” (the importance of light, water and soil to sustain life), “The Pledge” (the ability to take charge of scientific experiments and what they really are.)

results.title: Emus: curious companions. Echidna: the survivor
results.creator_credit: Mike Piper, Richard Campbell, Jim Roberts, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Piper Films
results.brief_description: Two separate episodes examine two of Austalia’s best-loved animals, the emu and the echidna. ‘Emu - curious companions’ follows the work of researcher Cate Coddington. Her study of one of Australia’s most recognisable birds involved following a group of emus through a cold Canberra winter. In the process she discovered startling information about their breeding habits and social systems. ‘Echidna - the survivor’, filmed on Kangaroo Island, South Australia, presents one of Australia’s least-known mammals, through the work of researchers Dr. Peggy Rismiller and Mike McKelvey.

results.title: Five easy pizzas
results.creator_credit: Clayton Jacobson, Garry Richards, Mark Hanlin, Ray Boseley, Jo Bell and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A collection of five Australian short comedy films, linked by a pizza delivery man having one of those days when nothing seems to go right. “Bernie’s Magic Moment”: a fanatical Collingwood football club supporter (Chris Haywood) is doing the ironing and gets carried away watching a football match; “Gran’s Big Adventure”: Bunney Brooke plays an old lady who becomes locked in a sofa and ends up having a ball of a time; “Midday Crisis”: a man training to be a private investigator discovers the wisdom in not interfering in a neighbour’s business; “Environmental”: a nerdy guy (Kym Gyngell) is terrorised by a radical greenie; “Prickly Heat”: the pizza delivery man finally loses his cool completely. A very funny and stylish collection of films.

results.title: Like water for chocolate = Como agua para chocolate
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Arau and Arau Films International
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning Mexican film which tells the story of Tita who is forbidden by tradition and a tyrannical mother to marry Pedro. Tita finds solace for her suppressed passion and sorrow in her cooking, which has a profound effect on all who partake. Based on Laura Esquivel’s best-seller, “Like water for chocolate” is an enchanting film which radiates warmth and emotional depth. It is visual feast starring Marco Leonardi, Lumi Cavazos and Regina Torne. Spanish dialogue. English subtitles.
